result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul E Wise was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

To pay the costs of the action on each count.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Maintain full-time employment as directed by probation agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: Huber release granted. To commence forthwith.

Transcript - Sentencing Hearing held 2-21-2020
Character letters from Suzanne York and Carter Campbell on defendants behalf.

03:30 PM Defendant Paul E Wise in court with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson.  Defendant Paul E Wise in custody.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. State/Defense ready to proceed without an updated PSI.  State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation, make statements. Defendant makes statement to the court.  Court makes statement, imposes sentence.

Defendant Paul E Wise in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Defendant Paul E Wise in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. records.addlTxt: Defendant Paul E Wise in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Defendant Paul E Wise in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 2 & 4. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 2 & 4. Court dismisses Cts. 1, 3 & 5 but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. Court orders PSI.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Paul E Wise in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Defendant Paul E Wise in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers would like some time to review discovery with defendant before proceeding. State has no objection to continuance. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Paul E Wise in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Defendant Paul E Wise in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers feels matter will resolve short of trial, requests another status in early January. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Request for Subpoena for Documents from DT Acceptance Corp. and Return of Subpoena for Document
Defense Discovery Demand
Audio/Video Supplementary Discovery Demand
Return of officer, acknowledgment of return of officer
Application for search warrant and affidavit.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Paul E Wise in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Defendant Paul E Wise in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Preliminary hearing at 10-28-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Paul E Wise in court with attorney Peter Heyne on behalf of Atty Greg Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, requests preliminary hearing within time limits. Court will schedule prelim. within the 10 day time limit. Bond remains in effect.
Return of Officer, Acknowledgment of Return of Officer
Application for Search Warrant and Affidavit
To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center. Not to leave Door County.

Defendant Paul E Wise appears by video conference.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 10/26/15 at 10:00 am.
